intro: Schizacme helmsii, commonly known as the narrow-leaved scurfpea, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its distinctive pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has small, trifoliate leaves with a hairy texture. Its flowers are usually pale blue or purple and are clustered in dense inflorescences. Schizacme helmsii plays a role in stabilizing soil in arid environments and provides nectar for pollinators.
